title: add examples of OIDC config to docs and have a better error when the claims-path is incorrect
body:
### Description

The documentation at https://quarkus.io/guides/security-openid-connect#token-claims-and-securityidentity-roles
describes examples of setting the quarkus.oidc.roles.role-claim-path property but doesn't describe when the examples are used.





### Implementation ideas

e.g., what is the difference between these? "customroles, customroles/array"
and why would you need these? "http://namespace-qualified-custom-claim"/roles, "http://namespace-qualified-roles"

An example of accessToken or idTokens for which these paths would be used would be helpful.

Also, if the role-claim-path is invalid, it'd help if Quarkus dumped out the token it's looking in and say "couldn't find this path in this token" in the logs.  I fat fingered the path name: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/discussions/26096 and that made me think the @RolesAllowed mapping didn't work properly.
